report.title: Humbling Experience for Seasoned Traveller
report.author: The Professor
report.bodytext: I was in Amsterdam, and didn't know about the drug -- got it at a 'Smart Shop,' eager to try it. In my tiny hotel room, alone, I filled a bowl. The TV was on. Nothing happened, so I smoked a second bowl. Waiting. . . /n /n Zap! I was somewhere else, a place without three dimensions. I think it had two dimensions, but I'm not sure. I felt frightened and smothered. I couldn't breath. /n /n Visually, everything was both the same and not the same. Grand colorful patterns in constant motion, but when I recall what I saw it was my small hotel room. /n /n The voice on the television, (I don't understand Dutch) was saying things right to me, directly addressing my situation. /n /n In the same way as a lot of other people reported, I had completely forgotten that I had smoked the drug. I was scared. /n /n And there was a lucid part of me that said, 'You're in a foreign country, and you've gone completely insane, and they will have to carry you out of here in a straightjacket, on a stretcher.' What will happen to me? There was no question that I would never be able to escape from this two dimensional world where I could not breathe and did not know how to move. I was in a lot of trouble. /n /n I screamed. I think what I said was 'Help!' Really dumb to yell help in a hotel in a country not one's own. At that point I came pretty much down and was expecting the Dutch police to break into my room at any moment. I ran out in the hall and down the steps so they would not find me and a few minutes later came back into my room feeling foolish. /n /n I was shocked! In the '60s I was the acid superman. If people told me that 1/4 of Mighty Quinns (a local acid) was scary, I would take two wholes. But this stuff scared the shit out of me. /n /n I looked on it as a challenge, and tried it a number of times more. Each time I was frightened, and forgot that I had taken the drug. The second time I thought I had greatly improved because I had managed not to scream. The third time I managed to maintain some Yoga breathing, but my breath came in and out of a pink volcano. All my consciousness was in my breath, but I was still scared, and it was all that I could do to keep from losing myself in the fear. /n /n I tried it a few more times but never got good control. I still have some but will save it until I feel ready, or until I get a good guide. /n /n I wish someone had been with me to keep me focused.
